subSections.title: Chinese
subSections.text: {{zh-forms|t2=佈|note={{lang|zh|佈}} – “to spread; to proclaim; to arrange; etc.”}}

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
;"to spread out" (tr.)
:Likely from {{inh|zh|sit-pro|-}}. {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} considers this sense to be cognate with:
:* {{och-l|博|tr=pâk}}, {{och-l|博|tr=phâʔ}}, {{och-l|敷|tr=pha}}, & {{och-l|甫|tr=paʔ}}; as well as
:* outside Sinitic, with Proto-{{w|Kuki-Chin languages|Kuki-Chin}} *'''phaʔ''', whence {{cog|lus|phah||spread (as cloth, etc), to place flat on the ground}}, {{cog|cnh|phaʔ||spread out cloth}}, {{cog|ctd|phaʔ³||spread a flat object}}, {{cog|tcz|phàa}}, {{m|tcz|phàt||spread out cloth}} 

;"cloth"
:"Cloth" is often thought to be the same etymon as "to spread (out)" (tr.). Alternatively, Schuessler thinks this sense's {{der|zh|aav}} origin more likely. Indeed, a late [[Han]] ([[漢]]) dynasty's word for "[[cotton]]", [[幏布]] *''ka<sup>(H)</sup>-puo<sup>H</sup>'' ({{w|Shuowen Jiezi|Shuowen}}, {{w|Book of the Later Han|Hou Hanshu}}), was borrowed from the Austroasiatic-speaking {{w|Nanman|Man}}-{{w|Dongyi|Yi}} peoples, and a Sanskrit loan (c. 430 CE) into Northwestern dialect is [[古貝]] *''ko<sup>X</sup>-pei<sup>H</sup>''. Compare {{cog|aav-pro|*k-rn-pas}} and {{cog|mkh-pro|*kpaas||cotton}}, whence {{cog|km|ក្របាស}}, {{cog|bdq|kơpaih}}, {{cog|mkh-vie-pro|*k-paːs}} (→ {{cog|vi|vải}} & {{cog|mtq|pái}}). 

:Additionally, Schuessler suggests that the Austroasiatic word was the source of {{cog|sa|कर्पास}} & {{cog|grc|κάρπασος}}. Still, earlier {{zh-ref|Johnson & Decker (1980)}} stated that "the problem of etymological origin of karpāsa has not been resolved".
